    • Method Detail

      • sortBy1stArgThen2nd

        public static void sortBy1stArgThen2nd​(float[] a1,
                                       float[] a2)
        sort by increasing value a1 and apply same changes to a2. Ties are further sorted by increasing values of a2. runtime is O(N * log_2(N))
        Parameters:
        a1 - array of points to be sorted
        a2 - array of points to apply a1 sorting to also

      • sortBy1stArg

        public static void sortBy1stArg​(float[] a1,
                                float[] a2)
        sort by increasing value a1 and apply same changes to a2. runtime is O(N * log_2(N))
        Parameters:
        a1 - array of points to be sorted
        a2 - array of points to apply a1 sorting to also

      • sortBy1stArgThen2nd

        public static void sortBy1stArgThen2nd​(int[] a1,
                                       int[] a2)
        sort by increasing value a1 for ties sort by a2. Ties are further sorted by increasing values of a2. runtime is O(N * log_2(N))
        Parameters:
        a1 - array of points to be sorted
        a2 - array of points to apply a1 sorting to also

      • sortBy1stArgThen2nd

        public static void sortBy1stArgThen2nd​(int[] a1,
                                       int[] a2,
                                       int[] a3)
        sort by increasing value a1 for ties sort by a2 and apply same changes to a3. Ties are further sorted by increasing values of a2. runtime is O(N * log_2(N))
        Parameters:
        a1 - array of points to be sorted
        a2 - array of points to apply a1 sorting to also, and its used for sorting when a1's are equal.
        a3 - array of points to apply a1 sorting to also

      • sortBy1stArgThen2nd

        public static void sortBy1stArgThen2nd​(float[] a1,
                                       float[] a2,
                                       int[] a3)

      • sortByYThenX

        public static void sortByYThenX​(PairIntArray xy)
        sort by increasing value y. Ties are further sorted by increasing values of x. runtime is O(N * log_2(N))
        Parameters:
        xy - array of points to be sorted

      • sortBy1stDescThen2ndAsc

        public static void sortBy1stDescThen2ndAsc​(int[] a,
                                           double[] b,
                                           java.lang.Integer[][] c,
                                           int[] d)
        sort so that a is decreasing in value for higher indexes and b is is increasing in value for higher indexes for the same a. swap operations for a and b logic are performed on c and d too.
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        c -
        d -

                                           double[] b,
                                           int[] c)
        sort so that a is decreasing in value for higher indexes and b is is increasing in value for higher indexes for the same a. swap operations for a and b logic are performed on c and d too.
        Parameters:
        a -
        b -
        c -

      • sortBy1stArg

        public static void sortBy1stArg​(float[] a1,
                                float[] a2,
                                int idxLo,
                                int idxHi)
        Parameters:
        a1 - array of points to be sorted
        a2 - array of points to apply a1 sorting to also
        idxLo - starting index of sorting of a1, inclusive
        idxHi - stopping index of sorting of a1, inclusive

      • sortByDecr

        public static void sortByDecr​(int[] a1,
                              int[] a2)
        sort by decreasing value a1 and apply same changes to a2. Ties are further sorted by increasing values of a2. runtime is O(N * log_2(N))
        Parameters:
        a1 - array of points to be sorted
        a2 - array of points to apply a1 sorting to also
